channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: England and Wales prison checks to be enhanced after inmate released in error
item.description: Justice secretary David Lammy to announce series of measures after Hadush Kebatu was wrongly freed Prisons are expected to begin enhanced checks befor...

item.title: Grave fears for civilians after Sudanese paramilitary claims capture of El Fasher
item.description: RSF says it has seized control of army’s main base in Darfur, home to famine-stricken displacement camp Fears are growing for hundreds of thousands of...

item.title: Javier Milei hails ‘tipping point’ as his far-right party wins Argentina’s midterm elections
item.description: Result falls short of giving Milei a congressional majority but surprises many analysts after series of scandals The party of Argentina’s far-right pr...

item.title: Minister insists government will get asylum seekers out of hotels and expects progress ‘within weeks’ - UK politics live
item.description: Housing secretary says purpose built ‘modular’ structures on sites like ex military bases is the answer to ending reliance on hotels Prisons are expec...

item.title: Lithuania to close border with Belarus after balloons shut down Vilnius airport – Europe live
item.description: 66 objects spotted on radars overnight leading to fourth closure of airport in a week as prime minister says any more balloons will be shot down Elsew...

item.title: UN pleads for safe passage for civilians trapped in war-hit Sudan city
item.description: The fall of el-Fasher would cement the RSF's control of the west and reinforces a de facto split in the nation.

item.title: Man arrested over racially-aggravated rape in Walsall
item.description: It comes after a woman, aged in her 20s, was attacked in the Park Hall area of Walsall on Saturday.

item.title: Offshore energy firm Petrofac files for administration
item.description: The energy services provider, which had been undergoing a financial restructuring, employs about 2,000 people in Scotland.

item.title: Home Office squandered billions on asylum hotels, MPs say
item.description: "Flawed contracts" and "incompetent delivery" left the department unable to cope with demand for asylum accommodation, a report by MPs suggests.

item.title: Argentina's Milei wins big in midterms with 'chainsaw' austerity
item.description: Milei's radical spending cuts have won favour with Donald Trump, but also attracted widespread criticism.
